Description: About the job  Company Description  Colonial Life & Accident Insurance Company, a subsidiary of Unum Group, provides workplace benefits such as disability, life, accident, dental, cancer, critical illness, and hospital confinement indemnity insurance to America‚Äôs workers and their families. They support over 87,000 businesses and 4 million workers with their benefit services, education, and innovative enrollment technology. In 2022, Colonial Life paid more than $700 million in benefits to policyholders.     Role Description  Colonial Life‚Äôs Springfield, Massachusetts Metropolitan Area territory is looking for motivated independent agent sales representatives to connect with customers and offer voluntary benefits that provide employees with financial protection during life‚Äôs unexpected events. As a sales representative, you will have the unique opportunity to focus on what you do best, with the ability to specialize in a role to help you succeed.     If you are driven by protecting your community and helping others, look no further than becoming a Colonial Life independent sales representative. We provide voluntary benefits at the worksite that offer employees financial protection when the unexpected happens. Partnering with Colonial Life means making a difference while benefiting from Colonial Life‚Äôs 80+ years of integrity, collaboration, innovation, and growth. Colonial Life supports its independent agents throughout their journey with a people-first culture.     The Agency Sales Representative will be responsible for connecting with potential clients, understanding their insurance needs, and providing tailored benefit solutions. Daily tasks include building and maintaining client relationships, conducting presentations and benefits enrollments, and coordinating with team members to achieve sales targets. The role requires consistent follow-up and excellent customer service skills.     Qualifications  Strong sales and negotiation skills Experience with client relationship management Excellent communication and presentation skills Familiarity with insurance products and services Highly motivated and goal-oriented Proficient in using technology for sales processes Ability to work independently and as part of a team

About the job  Company Description  We suggest you enter details here. About the job  We are looking for a Technical Co-Founder (Future CTO)  DianAI is building an AI system based on clinically structured trauma therapy protocols (EMDR & ImTT). The goal is to develop an AI that can apply real therapeutic steps in a standardized, safe, and measurable way ‚Äî not just chat or provide coping tips.     Role  You will lead the technical development and define the architecture of our LLM-based system. You will be part of the founding team with responsibility over product direction, model performance, and long-term scalability.     What you should bring  Hands-on experience setting up and fine-tuning LLMs (open-source or proprietary) Knowledge in RAG, embeddings, vector databases, multi-agent architectures Experience developing custom LLM pipelines or adapting foundation models Strong backend engineering skills (Python, PyTorch, HuggingFace, LangChain, APIs) Interest in building a proprietary therapeutic model from structured protocols Entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to take ownership  What we offer  Co-founder position with equity Opportunity to build a new category in mental health technology Collaboration with experts in psychology, AI, and health innovation Remote-first, flexible work setup  Objective  We are looking for someone who wants to build this from the ground up with us ‚Äî with a clear path to becoming CTO.  üì© Contact: diana@dianai.ai      üí¨ Or send me a message here on LinkedIn.

About the job  About KPC Finance  KPC Finance is an international investment and venture capital firm specializing in innovation, blockchain, and emerging technologies.   Our mission is to empower the next generation of entrepreneurs and accelerate the adoption of Web3 through strategic investments, data-driven products, and ecosystem partnerships.  We‚Äôre expanding our product organization and seeking a Product Manager | Crypto & Web3 to lead the strategy, roadmap, and execution of digital products that power our blockchain ecosystem, trading platforms, and venture operations.  This is a fully remote role ‚Äî perfect for a strategic, hands-on product leader who thrives at the intersection of technology, finance, and decentralized innovation.     Role Overview  As a Product Manager, you will define and drive the roadmap for KPC Finance‚Äôs Web3 products ‚Äî from trading and analytics tools to blockchain-based venture platforms.   You‚Äôll collaborate closely with engineers, designers, and business stakeholders to bring new crypto-native solutions to market and enhance our users‚Äô experience across both retail and institutional layers.     Key Responsibilities Define and execute the product vision and roadmap for KPC Finance‚Äôs Web3 and crypto platforms. Translate complex blockchain concepts (DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Layer-1/2) into intuitive user experiences. Collaborate with engineering and design teams to develop, test, and launch new product features. Conduct market research, user interviews, and competitor analysis to guide product strategy. Define and monitor key product KPIs, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Work with business development and marketing teams on go-to-market strategies and community growth. Identify strategic partnership opportunities with protocols, exchanges, and ecosystem players. Drive continuous product improvement through feedback loops and data-driven insights.     Qualifications 4‚Äì8 years of experience in product management within fintech, blockchain, or SaaS environments. Deep understanding of Web3 technologies, including smart contracts, DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and tokenomics. Proven track record of building and scaling crypto or blockchain-based products. Strong analytical skills with experience in defining KPIs, A/B testing, and user research. Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and leadership abilities. Experience working with distributed engineering teams in an agile environment. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, or Engineering (MBA or similar advanced degree preferred).     What‚Äôs Offered  Compensation: $160,000 ‚Äì $190,000 annual base salary   Performance-based bonuses tied to product milestones and adoption metrics   Equity participation in select product and venture initiatives   Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance (U.S.)   Paid time off and unlimited personal days based on performance and accountability   100% remote work with flexible hours and global collaboration   Annual company offsites and attendance at major Web3 conferences   Professional development allowance for courses, certifications, and industry events     Why Join Us Shape the next generation of Web3 products and user experiences. Collaborate with a world-class global team of engineers, traders, and venture experts. Play a key role in bridging traditional finance and decentralized technologies. Join a company where innovation, autonomy, and impact truly matter.

Job Title: AI Contact Center (CCaaS) Support Engineer - (Two Positions)
Description: About the job  AI Contact Center (CCaaS) Support Engineer - (Two Positions)     Contivio is a global leader in AI-ready enterprise SaaS contact center and telephony solutions. Our patented toolbar and CRM integration technologies power multi-channel, AI-capable communication platforms that help businesses improve sales and customer support.     We‚Äôre hiring two Support Engineers (one Senior and one Junior) to join our U.S. operations onsite at our Irvine, CA headquarters. This is not a remote position. Local candidates or those willing to commute daily are strongly preferred.     The ideal candidate has a strong VoIP or CCaaS background, thrives in a fast-paced, customer-driven environment, and takes ownership of deliverables and deadlines. For the senior position, we‚Äôre especially looking for someone who can lead the Irvine-based team and ensure technical and customer success.     Responsibilities  Triage, troubleshoot, and resolve customer issues related to Contivio‚Äôs VoIP and contact center platform. Reproduce, document, and escalate product defects to Engineering. Act as a liaison between customers, Engineering, and Product teams. Lead by example in accountability, customer satisfaction, and technical excellence. Contribute to our knowledge base through documentation and videos. Collaborate with global teams in the U.S., Egypt and Australia.     Requirements  BS/BA in Computer Science, Communications Engineering, or equivalent experience. 2‚Äì3+ years of hands-on experience with VoIP / Contact Center platforms (e.g., Five9, InContact, DialPad, Avaya, Cisco, etc.) for senior role. 1‚Äì2 years of relevant technical experience or transferable skills for junior role. Strong understanding of SIP, RTP, STUN, HTTP, TCP/IP. Solid networking fundamentals: routing, switching, NAT, QoS, firewalls. Experience using Wireshark, ping, traceroute, and similar tools. Proven ability to troubleshoot remotely and communicate clearly with customers. Customer-first mindset and accountability for deliverables and timelines.     Preferred (Senior Role)  Experience leading or mentoring technical teams. Familiarity with CRM-integrated telephony or CCaaS platforms. Demonstrated success meeting project deadlines under pressure.     Location and Compensation  Location: Onsite at Contivio HQ, Irvine, CA (local candidates strongly preferred) Competitive salary based on experience, performance-based bonuses, and full benefits package.     How to Apply   Apply via LinkedIn and email a short note to Careers@contivio.com including:  Your hands-on VoIP experience (tools, protocols, and projects) Confirmation that you are local to or can commute to Irvine, CA Why you‚Äôre excited to join Contivio     Applicants who exaggerate their VoIP or CCaaS experience will be technically tested during the hiring process.     Contivio is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

Nice to Haves  ‚Ä¢ Experience with GraphQL, Git/GitHub Actions, and AI tools (e.g., cloud-based solutions).  ‚Ä¢ Exposure to event-based architecture.  ‚Ä¢ Startup experience or having built products from the ground up.  ‚Ä¢ Enjoys working in fast-paced, loosely structured environments with minimal existing processes.  ‚Ä¢ Experience in advanced engineering teams‚Äî‚Äúgloves off‚Äù environment, requiring both proactive and reactive approaches to change.  ‚Ä¢ Passion for engineering and adaptability to evolving requirements.     Responsibilities  ‚Ä¢ Lead the design and implementation of user-facing features in web applications.  ‚Ä¢ Design scalable and maintainable frontend architectures (originally listed as Vue3 and TypeScript; for this project, React/Redux is required).  ‚Ä¢ Conduct and participate in code reviews.  ‚Ä¢ Optimize frontend performance.  ‚Ä¢ Write unit and end-to-end tests.  ‚Ä¢ Maintain technical documentation.  ‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with backend developers, designers, and other team members.     Skills  ‚Ä¢ Deep Expertise in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3 (including preprocessors like SASS/LESS).  ‚Ä¢ Experience with responsive and mobile-first design.  ‚Ä¢ Integration with RESTful APIs.  ‚Ä¢ Proficiency with Git and related workflows.  ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with build tools (Webpack, Babel, npm/yarn).  ‚Ä¢ Debugging using browser developer tools.  ‚Ä¢ Experience with CI/CD pipelines.  ‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving and creative thinking skills. Strong experience with Node JS and AWS  Familiar with terraform     Nice to Haves:  Experience with graphQL, git/github actions, Ai tools - clod, event based architecture  Start up experience, has built up products from the beginning of the lifecycle  Enjoys working in fast paced environments with not a lot of existing processing - it is a loose flow team. This is an advanced engineering team - ‚Äúgloves off‚Äù environment. They need to be proactive and reactive to change and passionate about what they do        Benefits (employee contribution):  Health insurance  Health savings account  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Flexible spending accounts  Life insurance  Retirement plan     All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Title: Staff Software Development Engineer - Front End with verification
Description: About the job  Job Title: Front-end Software Development Engineer  Location: Chicago, IL ( Preferred) / New York, NY  About Us: At Clearwater Analytics, we are on a mission to become the world's most trusted and comprehensive technology platform for investment management, reporting, accounting, and analytics. We partner with sophisticated institutional investors worldwide and are seeking a Front-end Software Development Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and client commitment.  Role Overview: We are looking for a highly skilled Front-end Software Development Engineer with over 15 years of total experience, including hands-on experience in Front Office architecture and coding. This role requires deep technical expertise in cloud technologies and distributed architecture, with a strong commitment to engineering and operational excellence.  Key Responsibilities:   Design and develop scalable, high-performance software solutions in a distributed architecture environment.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that engineering strategies align with business objectives and customer needs.  Implement real-time and asynchronous systems with a focus on event-driven architecture.  Ensure operational excellence by adhering to best practices in software development and engineering.  Present technical concepts and project updates clearly to stakeholders, fostering effective communication.    Requirements:    15+ years of hands-on software engineering experience, with a focus on architecture and coding in the FinTech sector (strong Front Office experience preferred).  Deep expertise in cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and distributed architectures.  Experience with real-time systems, event-driven architecture, and engineering excellence in a large-scale environment.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Strong problem-solving skills Ability to see the big picture while still giving attention to detail.  Strong command of unit testing for thorough code coverage.   Front end:   Experience with React Native, Angular, or any other modern front-end framework (this is team specific)  Experience with typescript in an object-oriented or functional paradigm  Experience making reusable front end components  Experience using front-end specific testing libraries (Jest, cypress, etc)  Experience using front-end build processes (webpack, rollup, etc) Containerization and front-end infrastructure knowledge is a plus   Desired Qualifications:   Experience in both FinTech and BigTech environments, with a strong understanding of investment management at scale.  Familiarity with GenAI/AI technologies and their applications within the financial services industry.    What we offer:   Business casual atmosphere in a flexible working environment  Team-focused culture that promotes innovation and ownership  Access cutting-edge investment reporting technology and expertise  Defined and undefined career pathways, allowing you to grow your way  Competitive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits  Maternity and paternity leave  Personal Time Off and Volunteer Time Off to give back to the community  RSUs, as well as an employee stock purchase plan and a 401 (k) with a match  Work from anywhere 3 weeks out of the year  Work from home Fridays    Why Join Us? This is an incredible opportunity to lead a passionate engineering team that is shaping the future of investment management technology. If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a significant impact, apply now!  Salary Range  $179,400.00 - $243,136.45  This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits include: health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), PTO, parental leave, and medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits. Clearwater Analytics is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Job Title: Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer with verification
Description: About the job  Unable to partner with 3rd party vendors (Corp-to-Corp/C2C) for this opportunity. We are unable to sponsor at this time. Relocation assistance is not provided.      About the Role  We are seeking a Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer with a strong growth mindset, a passion for learning, and a track record of thriving in enterprise environments. This role is perfect for a highly experienced engineer who is fluent in both frontend and backend development, adept at working asynchronously across global time zones, and comfortable navigating the trade-offs of Vibe Coding.     You'll be a key contributor in a fast-paced, innovation-driven team, building scalable applications using modern technologies such as React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and TypeScript-with exposure to AWS, NestJS, and even GoLang for high-performance enhancements. If you're excited about collaborating with AI-assisted development tooling and evolving your fullstack expertise in a high-ownership environment, this is the opportunity for you.     Key Responsibilities  Design, develop, and maintain fullstack web applications using JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Node.js. Develop backend APIs using frameworks like NestJS and/or raw Node.js. Work with PostgreSQL databases to ensure scalable and reliable data modeling and access. Leverage Docker and AWS to deploy and scale cloud-native applications. Apply Vibe Coding principles in a collaborative team environment, supported by AI-assisted tooling. Write clean, maintainable code and contribute to code reviews, technical planning, and design discussions. Collaborate across distributed teams in multiple time zones using async-friendly communication and documentation. Continuously seek to improve system performance, developer experience, and operational efficiency-including exploring GoLang for performance-critical components.     Required Qualifications  7+ years of hands-on fullstack development in large-scale enterprise environments. Advanced enterprise proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript. Strong work experience with React and Node.js in production. Solid understanding and hands-on work experience with PostgreSQL. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, modern dev workflows, and agile practices. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically in ambiguous situations. Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration and asynchronous communication. Exposure to or interest in AI-powered development workflows and productivity tools. Comfort with the advantages and trade-offs of Vibe Coding methodologies. Knowledge of Docker and containerized development workflows. Hands-on experience working within AWS cloud services and deployment pipelines.     Preferred Skills  Experience with NestJS for building efficient, scalable server-side applications. Familiarity with GoLang for performance enhancement or backend service optimization.     Unable to partner with 3rd party vendors (Corp-to-Corp/C2C) for this opportunity. We are unable to sponsor at this time. Relocation assistance is not provided.

Job Title: Full Stack Software Developer with verification
Description: About the job  Our Mission  At Palo Alto Networks¬Æ everything starts and ends with our mission:  Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we‚Äôre looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.  Who We Are  This role is remote, but distance is no barrier to impact. Our hybrid teams collaborate across geographies to solve big problems, stay close to our customers, and grow together. You will be part of a culture that values trust, accountability, and shared success where your work truly matters.  Job Description  We are seeking a versatile and talented Full Stack Software Developer to design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable software applications. As a core member of our development team, you will manage the full application lifecycle, from front-end user experience to back-end logic and data management. While your primary focus will be on software development, you will also play a crucial role in integrating pre-existing AI/ML models and services to build new, intelligent features within our applications. The ideal candidate has a passion for building user-centric software and is eager to explore and integrate emerging AI capabilities to create a more powerful product.  Key Responsibilities   Full Stack Application Development: Build and maintain web applications using modern front-end frameworks and robust back-end services. Feature Integration: Implement new features and functionality across the application stack, from crafting user-facing interfaces to developing back-end APIs. AI/ML Integration: Work with APIs and specialized cloud services to integrate pre-built AI/ML models (e.g., natural language processing, generative AI, or recommendation engines) into application features. API Development: Design and develop RESTful or GraphQL APIs to enable communication between the front-end, back-end, and AI/ML services. Automated Testing and Pipelines: Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated testing and deployment pipelines to ensure code quality and stability. Database Management: Interact with relational and non-relational databases to manage data and optimize queries for application performance. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with product managers, designers, and AI/ML engineers to understand business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions. Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Debug, maintain, and upgrade existing software, addressing issues across the entire application stack.   Qualifications  Required Skills and Qualifications   Technical Experience: 5+ years of experience in full stack software development. AI Rapid Development: Strong experience with generative AI development tools (e.g., Gemini CLI, Claude Code, Codex CLI) to accelerate the software development lifecycle, including code generation, debugging, and workflow automation. Back-End Development: Strong experience with server-side languages and frameworks such as Python (Flask, Django) and Typescript (Node.js). AI/ML Knowledge (Integration Focus): Strong experience integrating pre-trained AI/ML models and APIs (e.g., OpenAI, AWS AI Services, Google Cloud AI). No primary experience in model training is required. API Integrations: Strong experience designing, building, and consuming APIs. Front-End Development: Strong experience in HTML, CSS, and Typescript using a modern front-end framework like React, Angular, or Vue.js. Version Control: Proficiency with version control systems like Git. Databases: Proficiency with database management systems, both SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB). Problem-Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.   Preferred Qualifications   Experience with ReactJS development in NextJS. Experience with developing CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab. Experience working with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP. Experience with generative AI models and prompt engineering. Experience in an Agile/Scrum development environment. Proficient with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).   Additional Information  Compensation Disclosure  The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $160,000 - $220,000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.  Our Commitment  We‚Äôre problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity‚Äôs status quo. It‚Äôs simple: we can‚Äôt accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.  We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.  Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship? No. Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

Job Title: Staff Full Stack Software Engineer with verification
Description: About the job  At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader ‚Äî we‚Äôre changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We‚Äôre committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.  Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work ‚Äî every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.  Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers ‚Äî and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.  About The Team And The Role  We are eBay's Seller Experience Team! We are looking for an expert Staff Full Stack Software Engineer to join us and help build robust and scalable software, help improve our code services and system architecture, participate in brainstorming sessions and supply ideas to our technology, algorithms and products, and work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and deliver results.  We want the highest levels of technical talent and programming skills, as well as a keen desire to deeply understand our products and services to push our technology forward. You‚Äôll work alongside the most creative engineering talent in the industry.  What You Will Accomplish   Develop features and services in highly scalable and reliable backend systems in a distributed system environment. Able to translate product and design documents into clean, high-quality, well-tested and maintainable production code autonomously Write test automations and practice continuous integration Conduct code review for immediate team Develop and maintain user documentation to support software applications. Practices evidence-centered design making features testable, ensuring high quality and improving velocity in continuous delivery. Champion best practices in frontend development, prioritizing performance, scalability, and maintainability. Optimize applications for speed and scalability through efficient and clean code. Lead architectural decisions, component design, and overall user experience strategy for frontend solutions. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior developers, fostering a culture of quality coding, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing. Stay abreast of emerging industry trends, tools, and technologies Accountable for multiple subsystems within a larger domain, taking full responsibility for their entire life cycle, including design, development, testing, deployment, observability and monitoring. Structure and complete tasks independently, meeting timelines and achievements. Effectively communicate assumptions and seek clarification from partners, ensuring alignment and understanding across all domains. Lead engineering support, release, and on-call responsibilities for an "always-on" 24/7 site.    What You Will Bring   Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience preferred with 10+ years of hands on experience as full stack engineer. Java, Python, distributed systems, cloud-related knowledge, REST, GraphQL. Highly proficient in front-end technologies, including Typescript, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3, and modern web development frameworks and tools. Strong grasp of front-end build processes and tools such as Webpack, Babel, npm, and yarn. Proven ability to integrate with back-end services via RESTful APIs. In-depth understanding of responsive design and cross-browser compatibility. Experience with Next.js, GraphQL, and EXPO SDK is beneficial. Familiarity with AWS services (such as API Gateway, Lambda, EKS, Cognito, and DynamoDB) and back-end technologies (like Python and Node.js) is also a plus. Strong programming skills with deep understanding of object-oriented concepts, design patterns, and a proven grasp of the software development lifecycle. Strong learning ability, dedicated and passionate about new and innovative technologies within immediate field of expertise Strong applied experience. You‚Äôve built, broken, and rebuilt software applications Must be able to work 3 days out of the week in the Amsterdam office.    Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.  eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.  The eBay Jobs website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

About the job  Job Description  It is the responsibility of the Project Executive (PX) to act as the chief liaison between Vernon and the owner, architect, engineer, specialty consultants, and other members of the project team. It is the PX‚Äôs responsibility to ensure that the team is working harmoniously and meeting the overall project‚Äôs requirements, such as completing the project on schedule, within budget, and according to quality specifications. It is also the PX‚Äôs responsibility to acquire the proper resources to perform the work, often from department heads, or arrange for the hiring of personnel with the Human Resources department. The PX needs to keep upper management informed about the overall project status and bring major issues to upper management‚Äôs attention. The PX should also cultivate and maintain a positive relationship with all members of the project team (owner, lenders, brokers, consultants, and trade associations). The PX is ultimately responsible for the satisfaction of the client. The PX is involved in multiple projects at a time.      Responsibilities  ¬∑ Provide leadership in business judgment and all financial and profitability aspects of projects under your jurisdiction.     ¬∑ Participate extensively in the work acquisition process, working to define and develop project budgets and schedules that will achieve profitability objectives taking into account project-specific challenges.     ¬∑ Set appropriate milestones and assign staff qualified to handle the scope and complexity of the project.  ¬∑ Work closely with clients, owners, architects and subcontractors to develop relationships that exceed the client satisfaction to Vernon‚Äôs demanding standards.     ¬∑ Provide oversight in managing all necessary resources throughout the entire project from start-up through closeout and ensure that the Owner‚Äôs expectations regarding budget, schedule, and quality, as well as Vernon‚Äôs profitability objectives are met or exceeded. It is expected that the Project Executive owns the project from Pre-Construction thru Closeout and beyond. This involves:  o Oversight of projects at a high level from beginning to end including budget, costs, unexpected events, general performance, and overall progress against plan.  o Ensure that the day-to-day operations of projects are transitioned effectively to Project Managers and Superintendents from Preconstruction when work commences in the field.  o Mentor, train and coach staff to perform to or exceed Vernon standards.  o Represent Vernon to the Owner(s), Architects, Consultants, Government Authorities, Vendors and Subcontractors.     ¬∑ Project Acquisition  o Participate in bidding and estimating process to win projects  o Participate to understand unique owner needs, to represent Vernon capabilities and help close potential clients.  o Review projects for unique challenges that will impact budget/profitability objectives   o Utilize industry contacts and relationships to generate appropriate project leads and follow through to acquisition as required.  o Participate in and contribute to the RFP response process including editing for project specific content, and interview preparation and participation as requested.  o Participate in Contract negotiation      ¬∑ Project Start Up/Turnover/Pre-Construction  o Assign appropriate Project Staff (Includes Project Management and Field Staff)  o Review and approve the pre-mobilization activities.  o Ensure Turnover meeting occurs between Preconstruction and Operation teams  o Be the pre-construction lead as requested, working closely with the pre-construction and estimating teams to develop project specific budgets, schedules and logistics plans.  o Responsible for ensuring that Projects achieve budget, schedule, quality and profitability objectives.  ¬ß Maintain a thorough understanding of the Vernon/Owner Contract. Ensure project team understanding of same and that project achieves compliance with.  ¬ß Visit sites regularly to monitor project performance, schedule, and expenditures with project staff, highlight potential challenges and provide leadership in responding creatively to bring projects in on schedule and under budget, and to the standard of quality expected.     ¬∑ People:  o Monitor and evaluate Project Manager and Superintendent staff assignments  o Responsible for development of entire team  o Assist in sourcing and screening of candidates as requested; mentor, coach and train them to perform and ensure effective matching of talent to project scope     ¬∑ Financial Performance  o Cash Management  o Accounts Receivable  o Accurate Financial Forecasting  o P&L including full understanding of project contingencies, liabilities and savings potential     ¬∑ Schedule Performance  o Assist the project staff in the development of the Baseline Schedule  o Monitor schedule performance  o Assist the project team in initiation of workflow  o Ensure Project Staff understands and is trained in company procedures and monitor compliance     ¬∑ Safety  o Champion jobsite safety effort, motivating the on-site team in the implementation of Vernon‚Äôs ‚ÄòWinning‚Äô Safety Culture     ¬∑ Meeting Management  o Attend all scheduled meetings necessary to monitor and manage project profitability  o Chair and/or attend weekly project staff meetings     ¬∑ Client Relationships  o Attend owner and project meetings, maintain continuous client contact to gauge performance perceptions and communicate relevant information to Project Team  o Become the Vernon representative on the team     Qualifications  ¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a minimum of 10-15 years of construction management experience for a GC or CM at Risk firm  ¬∑ In-depth knowledge of intricate commercial construction practices required  ¬∑ Experience leading multiple successful project teams including development of direct reports and maintaining relationships with external entities  ¬∑ The ability to manage and embrace change. Respond and adapt to new processes.  ¬∑ Proactive, not reactive ‚Äì ability to foresee, anticipate and resolve issues before they happen  ¬∑ Experience working for New York State and New York City agencies (DASNY, OGS, SUCF, DDC, SCA, NYCHH, etc.)     If your answer to the following questions is ‚ÄúYES‚Äù then we encourage you to apply!  ¬∑ Are you interested in working with the best & brightest construction professionals in the NYC market?  ¬∑ Do you align with Vernon‚Äôs core values: Teamwork & Leadership, Innovation, Integrity, Quality, Relationships, and Safety?  ¬∑ Are you positive, energized, and passionate about your work?  ¬∑ Do you have a growth mindset and are constantly seeking perpetual improvement?  ¬∑ Do you have what it takes to help us in our vision to redefine the standard of excellence in our industry?     Salary  ¬∑ $200,000 - $275,000

About the job  Software Engineer ‚Äì Full-Stack (TypeScript / Node.js / Angular)  Location: Remote or Hybrid (U.S.)     Engagement: Long-Term Contract with potential to convert to full-time     The Opportunity  We‚Äôre partnering with a client doing a large-scale digital transformation ‚Äî rebuilding core business systems from the ground up using a modern, cloud-native tech stack. If you‚Äôre a strong TypeScript engineer ready to make an impact on a major transformation, we‚Äôd love to connect.

About the job  About Us:  Live experiences help people cross today‚Äôs digital divide and focus on what truly connects us ‚Äì the here, the now, this once-in-a-lifetime moment that‚Äôs bringing us together. To fulfill Gametime‚Äôs mission of uniting the world through shared experiences, we make it easy for people to discover and access the live experiences that matter most.  With platforms on iOS, Android, mobile web and desktop supporting more than 60,000 events across the US and Canada, we are reimagining the event ticket industry in order to move at the speed of life.  Job Summary:  Engineering at Gametime  You will be a key contributor to the Engineering team responsible for building and maintaining the client-side applications and backend systems that power the Gametime experience for millions of users. We empower engineers to take full ownership of their code and foster a culture grounded in testing, code reviews, observability, experimentation, and operational excellence. At Gametime, we value collaboration, inclusivity, and the strength of diverse perspectives ‚Äî creating an environment where people love to build together.  We are also investing deeply in the future of AI. This includes building internal tools and workflows powered by AI, incorporating agentic systems into our backend architecture, and preparing our marketplace and infrastructure to be AI-ready. Engineers are encouraged to explore and adopt AI capabilities in their development process, and those who contribute to advancing AI adoption within our stack will play a key role in shaping that evolution.  The Role  We are seeking a Backend Software Engineer to join the Supply Product team. This team is responsible for the technology and systems that power the supply side of the Gametime marketplace. This is a mid-level individual contributor (IC2) position for engineers who are developing their technical depth, execute reliably on scoped projects, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. You‚Äôll contribute to delivering backend features and infrastructure improvements while learning from senior engineers and growing toward greater autonomy.  Key Responsibilities:   Build and maintain Golang microservices that support inventory ingestion, ordering and fulfillment, and third-party integrations. Contribute to the design and development of backend features with guidance from senior team members. Write well-tested, maintainable, and observable code. Support and improve internal and external APIs that power the Gametime platform. Collaborate closely with Product, Design, and Data teams to deliver technical solutions aligned with user and business goals. Participate in team rituals including code reviews, sprint planning, and technical discussions. Learn and apply best practices in backend development, CI/CD, and system reliability. Contribute to a culture of inclusion, technical curiosity, and continuous improvement. Bonus: Explore ways to integrate AI-powered tools into backend workflows and development practices.   Key Competencies:   Backend Development: Hands-on experience building backend systems using Golang or other backend languages (e.g., Python, Java, Ruby, etc). System Fundamentals: Understanding of distributed systems principles, REST APIs, and backend application architecture. API Integration: Ability to work with internal and third-party APIs reliably and securely. Cloud Infrastructure: Exposure to AWS, GCP, or other cloud platforms is a plus. Event-Driven Systems (Bonus): Experience working with messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or similar. Databases: Experience with relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL) and/or NoSQL technologies (e.g. MongoDB, DynamoDB). Team Collaboration: Strong communication skills and a willingness to learn through collaboration. AI-Enhanced Development (Bonus): Interest or experience using AI tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor, ChatGPT, or similar to enhance engineering work.   Minimum Qualifications   Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Experience: 2-4 years in software engineering, preferably with backend systems   What We can Offer:   Flexible PTO Competitive salary & equity package Monthly Gametime credits for any event ($1,200/yr) Medical, dental, & vision insurance Life insurance and disability benefits Diverse Family-forming benefits through Carrot Fertility 401k, HSA, pre-tax savings programs Company off-sites and meet-ups Wellness programs Tenure recognition   At Gametime pay ranges are subject to change and assigned to a job based on specific market median of similar jobs according to 3rd party salary benchmark surveys. Individual pay within that range can vary for several reasons including skills/capabilities, experience, and available budget.  United States - Pay Range: $124,397 USD - $146,349 USD  Gametime is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.

Job Title: Director of Project Management with verification
Description: About the job  Location: Brooklyn, NY, Hybrid   Job Type: Full-time,   Reports to: CFO/COO  Salary: $120,000 - $150,000 DOE  Benefits: Medical, 401(k), PTO     About Now What  We are a research, insights, and strategy consultancy that works with bold, curious clients like Pfizer, Apple, J&J, Nike, Novartis, Disney, and Google to tackle their most complex questions about culture, behavior, brands, and the future. Our people are researchers, strategists, anthropologists, and insight rebels who blend rigor with creativity to help clients answer the hardest question of all: Now What?     Now What Health (NWH) is our growing healthcare vertical‚Äîwhere we bring our unique blend of empathy, insight, and strategic clarity to the most urgent and complex questions facing the healthcare world. With deep roots in pharma and growing capabilities across the healthcare landscape, we're seeking an experienced, subject matter expert/client leader to help build, shape, and scale NWH for the future.     The Role: Director of Project Management      Job Overview:  We are seeking a highly organized and strategic Director of Project Management to set the standard for how client projects are executed across the company. While this role does not directly manage a team, it plays a critical leadership function by establishing the processes, best practices, and workflows that guide the work of 30+ strategists.     Working closely with the Senior Director of Research, this individual will design and implement systems that ensure project efficiency, quality, and consistency. They will be responsible for training strategists on process adoption, reinforcing best practices, and creating the operational infrastructure that elevates the team‚Äôs work.     The ideal candidate will bring experience in market research or a related field (such as an agency or consultancy), along with proven strengths in process management, vendor coordination, and financial oversight. This role requires someone who can balance strategic vision with operational rigor, ensuring the entire strategist team is equipped to deliver seamless client experiences at scale.     Key Responsibilities:  Project Standards & Process Management  Identify, develop, and implement standardized project management processes and tools to the project teams to ensure consistency and efficiency across all client engagements, with input from Senior Team Monitor project progress, ensuring adherence to established frameworks and proactively addressing potential risks. Partner with the Head of Staffing to properly onboard new projects and align resources accordingly.     Vendor & Freelancer Management  Oversee relationships with key vendors, including research recruit, panel vendors and freelance consultants, ensuring smooth collaboration and adherence to project requirements. Manage contracts, negotiations, and performance tracking for external partners. Develop a reliable freelance network and maintain a roster of skilled specialists to support project needs. Serve as a key point of contact for project-related operational matters, ensuring clear communication between internal teams and vendors on our most complex projects.     Data Security & Compliance Management  Partner with data security consultants and technology support consultants and CFO to ensure full compliance with industry standards, client requirements, and internal policies. Oversee and coordinate recurring security checks, including penetration tests, vulnerability assessments, and any other required audits. Review, complete, and maintain all client-provided data security forms, assessments, and agreements, ensuring timely and accurate submission. Update, develop, document, and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) related to data protection, storage, and access control in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Monitor and enforce compliance with client-specific data retention and deletion policies, ensuring all project data is handled securely throughout its lifecycle. Serve as a key point of contact for data security matters within the project management function, ensuring the strategist team is informed and aligned with company standards.     Financial Oversight & Invoicing  Work closely with accounting consultants to ensure clients are invoiced accurately and in a timely manner upon project or phase completion. Partner with Head of Staffing to maintain Mavenlink (PM tool) to enhance project tracking, reporting, and collaboration. Track project budgets, ensuring financial accountability and alignment with forecasts. Monitor project profitability and identify opportunities for cost optimization.     Qualifications & Experience:  10 years of project management experience, ideally in marketing research or a related industry. Ideally has experience managing Healthcare/Pharma projects. Fielding experience a plus. Strong background in developing and maintaining project management frameworks. Experience managing vendor relationships. Familiarity with accounting processes related to invoicing and project financials. Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Kantata, Asana, Monday.com, Trello, Smartsheet). Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.     Submit your cover letter and resume to join our curious, tight-knit, trailblazing team.

Job Title: Frontend Software Engineer - Full Stack Track
Description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More  About Us  At InnerPlant (www.innerplant.com) we are on a mission to transform farming by enabling crops to communicate directly with farmers. By tapping into plants' immune systems, InnerPlant engineers crops that emit optical signals detectable as far away as space when under attack by disease, pests, or other stressors.  We‚Äôre backed by leading industry and venture partners, including John Deere and an alliance of North American farmers. InnerPlant is a place for people that believe they can make a difference and want to improve how decisions are made on the farm.  We are currently seeking a Frontend Engineer to push forward our work to deliver the signals from our plants to farmers. This key role would be accountable for ensuring that the software that our customers and partners use to interact with our product is intuitive, performant, and usable across the various devices present on the modern farm.  Responsibilities   Build and refine frontend interfaces our customers will use to interact with our flagship product, CropVoice. Design and implement customer data visualizations for internal stakeholders. Automate key customer interaction points, including transactional communications. Land in the frontend and expand to full stack, taking a holistic approach to systems design.   Requirements  Skills Summary   JavaScript/TypeScript and modern frontend frameworks (e.g. Svelte) Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and responsive design principles Experience with common development tools and services, such as version control software, package managers, and CI/CD pipelines  Bonus software skills : at least some experience with Python-based ORMs and REST API frameworks; familiarity with map frameworks (e.g. Leaflet, Mapbox) for spatial data visualization; exposure to cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS, GCP) and containerization  Interpersonal: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to contribute to a healthy engineering culture as well as relay technical concepts to non-engineers    Education, Experience, and Attributes   Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field At least one year of experience building software, with a focus on frontend components Long term mindset and outlook toward building maintainable systems Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn about remote sensing, plant biology, and the global food system Desire to learn and grow toward backend/full stack development Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team   Benefits  The US annual compensation range for this position is $91,000 to $133,000. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.  InnerPlant provides an amazing opportunity to work on some of the hardest problems facing humanity and help design the agricultural systems of the future. In addition to working with a fun team, we offer competitive compensation, benefits, and growth opportunities.  InnerPlant provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

About the job  Overview  Collateral Partners builds the collateral behind the capital ‚Äî helping investment firms communicate with sophistication and scale through institutional-grade decks, websites, and brands.     We‚Äôre hiring a Website Strategist to lead our website practice ‚Äî overseeing every aspect of digital engagements from strategy to launch. This person will own the process, direct our designers and developers, and guide clients through building high-impact, investor-grade websites that tell a clear, compelling story.     You‚Äôll combine strategic thinking, content design, and project leadership ‚Äî shaping how investment brands express themselves online.     Responsibilities1. Digital Strategy & Structure Lead discovery sessions with clients to define objectives, audiences, and key messages. Develop information architecture, site maps, and page-level content frameworks. Translate positioning and brand strategy into digital structure and flow. Create strategic briefs outlining copy direction, visual priorities, and user experience.     2. Copywriting & Content Direction Write or oversee all website copy ‚Äî from headlines to narrative flow. Ensure clarity, precision, and brand alignment in all content. Collaborate with clients to refine tone and language throughout revisions. Maintain consistency across site sections, CTAs, and investor communications.     3. Creative & Technical Management Manage designers and developers across concept, design, and build phases. Review wireframes, layouts, and final designs for narrative coherence and UX alignment. Oversee QA for copy, visuals, and functional delivery before launch. Implement scalable digital processes and templates for recurring client needs.     4. Client Leadership & Delivery Serve as the primary client lead for website engagements. Present strategy, structure, and creative direction confidently to executive stakeholders. Manage scope, expectations, and communication across internal and external teams. Identify opportunities for ongoing retainers or expanded digital partnerships.     Qualifications 3‚Äì7 years of experience in digital strategy, web production, or creative direction. Proven record managing website projects from discovery through launch. Strong writing and storytelling skills ‚Äî capable of producing and editing investor-facing copy. Deep understanding of UX, information architecture, and responsive design. Experience managing designers, developers, and cross-functional creative teams. Background in professional services or financial brands strongly preferred. Comfortable in a high-velocity, client-facing environment with multiple concurrent projects.     You‚Äôll Thrive Here If You‚Ä¶ Love building structure and clarity from complexity. Can toggle between big-picture brand strategy and micro-level copy decisions. Excel at managing creatives and clients with equal confidence. Value precision, polish, and narrative alignment in every detail.     About Collateral Partners  Collateral Partners is a financial communications firm that builds the materials behind the capital. We combine deep financial understanding with creative excellence ‚Äî delivering world-class brand, digital, and marketing systems for investment firms globally.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer I - Member Experience with verification
Description: About the job  Our mission: to eliminate every barrier to mental health.  At Spring Health, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize mental healthcare by removing every barrier that prevents people from getting the help they need, when they need it. Our clinically validated technology, Precision Mental Healthcare, empowers us to deliver the right care at the right time‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs therapy, coaching, medication, or beyond‚Äîtailored to each individual‚Äôs needs. About the job  We are looking for a critical thinking and highly motivated architectural designer with 3+ years of professional experience to join our team. We are a boutique architectural design firm focusing on high-end, private residential projects. Candidates should possess strong Revit and AutoCAD skills as well as be able to demonstrate their knowledge of, and enthusiasm for, the design process. We value a flexible, collaborative, and thoughtful approach to design. Dedicated, solutions-oriented individuals who are looking to expand their skills while embracing a growth mindset are encouraged to apply.     Qualifications     A degree in Architecture and 3 years minimum experience required as a draftsperson.  You will be responsible, and must be able to produce, full construction sets of drawings for residential homes.     High-end residential work experience preferred. Strong organizational skills. Revit and AutoCAD proficiency required. Must be US a resident, living in NYC metro area Must be fluent in English language Accredited masters program a plus Must be able to show real construction document work experience      Responsibilities     - Working on project permitting and the drafting of drawings for construction  - Code research and site analysis  - Shop drawing reviews  - Field-work  - Consultant coordination  - Department of Buildings submissions     About Our Company  NJ Caine Architecture designs an exclusive portfolio of high-end residences including Manhattan townhouses and Hamptons estates, with projects across the United States. Based in New York, with offices on the Upper East Side of Manhattan and an office and art gallery in East Hampton, the firm‚Äôs over 20 years of experience in high-end residential design informs a dedicated attention to detail and the elegant aesthetic which makes every project a vision of style.
